captions.text:
- So you come right here
around this pole right here,
turn to go to the, oh no, there it is.
Right at shin-height, right when
you're rushing to make the intersection,
ready to hurt you.

This is it, folks, the worst
fire hydrant in Los Angeles.
(upbeat electronic music)

I hope that your water
has saved thousands.
Los Angeles is not traditionally known
as a good public transit or mobility city,

but I can get to everywhere
using LA's public transit.

If I need to go somewhere,
it's only a matter of time.
And the sunglasses go back on.

And now it's bright so
we've gotta go hat too.

This was a gift from my
then-girlfriend, now fiance.
It's because I always have to wear hats
so I was stuck with these baseball caps
that weren't classy or interesting.
You couldn't wear them to work

or anything like that, so
she thought it'd be fun

to try to get some more
different and interesting hats.
I don't really like any hats.

A lot of times, you wind up
just copying and pasting it
into something that looks very plain.
(laughs)
(R&B music)
- [Voiceover] Mark, it's me!
- Uh, okay, walking directions,
what do you want from me?
The trick is, when the cars that are going
the same way you're going are going,
it's safe to walk.
Don't be fooled by left-turn arrows.
Those might kill you.
We're going to the comedy show.
ID time?

Do you need it outta the thing,
or can I flash it FBI style?

I'm going to attempt to order
two of a lower end drink.

Finding out what lower
end drinks are available
is the first challenge.
Sometimes I cave and just order
the thing who's name I just heard.

Hey, do you guys have any
specials or anything today?
Okay, uh-- (laughs)
What do you guys have on tap?
Oh, yeah.
I don't have my glasses on, I'm sorry.
It's not going as well as I had hoped.
I had to pull the glasses lie.

I'll just have two of
whatever the cheapest one is.
What do you recommend?
That could not have gone worse.

As far as me getting a
drink that I want quickly.
And without embarrassment.

I don't know why I don't
just say I can't see well.

I think people just
understand, "forgot my glasses"

so quickly that it doesn't
require any explaining.
'Cause it's not like they really care.
They just need to know how to do their job

and I'm trying not to admit
that I can't help them.
You can't win them all, you know?
Hi, can I get four pastor and one carne?
Oh, well, it's easy.
I play topping roulette (laughs)
You know, I've thought about it,

but I just don't want to
call that much attention.

There's a serious
embarrassment level to it,
and maybe it's just an insecurity thing,
but so often I would rather be perceived
as slightly awkward than handicapped.
It's hard because I would like to be
more than just that, you know?
Yeah, exactly.

I feel like I have other
things to contribute

and I would love for
those to be acknowledged.
There are a million small awkwardnesses
that creep into your day because
you don't have the same information
that everyone else has,
and part of the trick of dealing with it
is being honest, which I've failed at
a couple of times today.
I don't have my glasses on, so I honestly

not sure at all what any of
the options are. (laughs)
But another part of the trick of it
is hoping that people don't pass
character-assassinating judgements on you.
I guess it's really just, try your best
and hope that everyone's cool with it.
And here we are at the home.
Thank you to Keith for the ride
and for following me all day.

- It's me, it's really me.
- It's Keith!
- [Keith] Cool, see you buddy!

comments.text:
Funny... I literally just posted on a BuzzFeed video stating that the 
videos do not cater at all to blind people. If a blind person clicks on the 
videos to hear facts, all they hear is music instead, because the facts are 
written rather than spoken.﻿

comments.text:
I went to school with a friend who had the same prognosis at Marc, I 
remember being so angry  when the professor would as him "don't you see?" I 
did not know if I was upset for my friend or for myself, that some one 
could be so uncaring to a person who has limited sight.﻿

comments.text:
The bar thing got me right in the hearing aid. After a while you don't feel 
like making a fool out of yourself going "what", so it's just smile and 
nod. Then you get "you weren't listening" - no I wasn't *hearing* it﻿

﻿

comments.author: flamss

comments.text:
hi guys, like the man in the video i am also going blind. my eye doctor 
told me by the time i am 50, i will be completely blind. I am both short 
sighted and long sighted (which is rare) so its pretty tough. sometimes 
people in my class take my glasses and because everything is so fuzzy, i 
cant tell who is who (having uniforms doesnt help either) so there isnt 
anything I can do until i get help from a teacher ( normally i can just 
about make out who is a teacher) and get my glasses back. the only way you 
can see what my vision is like is by trying on my glasses as they are very 
stron g so it makes people with good eyesight hard to see stuff while they 
wear them. thankfully i have friends and family that help me deal with this 
as it can be pretty tough at times . so i am grateful that i have such good 
friends and family to help me out 😃 ﻿
comments.author: Dearbhla Whelan

comments.text:
Honestly, I think it is the peer pressure the world is impacting on people 
now, from celebrity news to normal lives. People can't be honest any more 
due to our society and how everyone can't seem to remember that everyone is 
different. Some people need to grow up. Marc, share you problem with the 
world, and the people who don't understand need to go not understand 
somewhere else. Always be you and it's pretty cool how you know how to work 
around things... If you don't like this opinion don't respond rudely. I was 
being honest, any other opinions I would like to know, if you agree with 
this comment like  :D...







I'm sorry if this doesn't make sense :P..









No harm in self- promotion 
              Tyler Oakley  :D﻿
